title: Quantitative Analysis with EDS and WDS at High Count Rates
content: Electron probe microanalysis (EPMA) in combination with energy and wavelength dispersive spectrometers (EDS, WDS) is a well-known and established technique to analyze elemental compositions. Standards-based analysis relies on k-ratios (ratios of peak intensity per time per beam current) between unknown samples and standards) and a matrix correction (e.g. XPP or PAP [1]), to determine accurate element concentrations.
